src:
Review Album: Potret - 'Nana Nana'
04 Nov 2019, 08:27 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Setelah 11 tahun, Potret melepas mini album bertajuk 'Nana Nana'. (CNN Indonesia/Safir Makki)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Di era 90-an, Potret muncul dan memberi kesegaran lewat album self titled pada 1995. Waktu itu Indonesia punya banyak sekali band, namun Melly Goeslaw yang menyanyikan lirik 'nakal' tetap mengejutkan publik. Tak butuh waktu lama sampai Potret mendapat stigma unik dan 'fun'. Lirik-liriknya berbeda dari kebanyakan lagu yang beredar saat itu, aransemennya cerdas, dan gaya Melly sebagai vokalis membuatnya mudah dikenali. Potret II dan Cafe menyusul pada 1997 dan 1998. Kemudian, From Dawn to Beyond (2001), Positive+POSITIVE (2003), serta I Just Wanna Say I L U (2008). Melly dan Anto Hoed sang suami lantas mengembangkan karier sebagai pasangan lagu tema film Indonesia paling populer, dan mau tak mau Potret pun tak mendapat perhatian seperti dulu lagi.Tiba-tiba, pada 25 Oktober Melly mengumumkan Potret memiliki mini album terbaru bertajuk Nana Nana. Artwork-nya ramai dan meriah, menampilkan Melly Goeslaw, Anto Hoed, Aksan Sjuman, Nikita Dompas, dan pianis Mery Kasiman sebagai pengisi Potret.Hanya ada lima lagu dalam mini album ini, dibuka oleh Nana Nana yang ceria, mengusung semangat 90-an Potret. Liriknya amat sederhana, dan Melly menyanyikannya dengan gaya lama. Bagian outro jelas menunjukkan lagu itu memang milik Potret.Lagu 90's ditempatkan sebagai yang kedua. Sekali lagi, Potret hanya menjadi dirinya sendiri dengan penulisan lirik 'asal' yang justru enak diucapkan. Lagu 90's seolah menegaskan mitos, 'era musik 1990-an adalah yang terbaik'."Mari semua berkumpul, mari semua bernyanyi, mari semua dengar musik 90's. Anak 90-an boleh bangga boleh senang, musik 90's paling berjaya," kata Melly, menambahi semangat itu dengan chant, "Hey! 90's!"


Potret dalam formasi lima orang telah bertahan sejak 2015 lalu. (CNN Indonesia/Endro Priherdityo)

Di lagu ini pula, Mery Kasiman memperdengarkan kemampuan memainkan tuts. Aransemen Lagu 90's terasa penuh, ramai, tapi menyenangkan. Karya yang memiliki penjiwaan band, segar di antara banyaknya lagu yang serba elektronik seperti hari ini.Dawai Gitar dibuka dengan ketukan yang sangat khas Melly Goeslaw. Masuk ke pertengahan lagu, tiba-tiba ia kehilangan nafas Potret. Rasanya lebih menyerupai lagu solo Melly, atau proyek lagu tema film percintaan Indonesia. Yang satu ini, berlalu begitu saja.Berikutnya, adalah Kenyataan. Lagu yang sama pernah dimuat dalam album Cafe (1999). Tidak banyak perubahan aransemen di sini, itu sebabnya Kenyataan punya rasa Potret paling kental. Pertama kali mendengar lagu ini di Nana Nana, rasanya seperti terlempar ke masa kecil. Aransemen Kenyataan versi baru ini lebih penuh, Melly juga menampilkan gaya bernyanyi yang lain dari sebelumnya. Mendengar Kenyataan, niscaya akan membuat rindu pada karya-karya lama Potret seperti Takut Terlambat dan Terbujuk.Sebagai penutup mini album Nana Nana, ada Gak Mau Galau. Sesuai judul, Melly berkeluh soal cinta. Ia mengambil warna vokal berbeda, dengan intro piano yang memiliki vibrasi seperti dalam Diam. Balada ala Potret, teror yang menghantui sampai lagu usai. Di unggahan Instagram di mana ia mempromosikan mini album ini, Melly menyampaikan bahwa Potret menggarap Nana Nana dengan cara 'organik'. Dalam artian, segala proses produksi dilakukan di studio di kediaman yang ia tinggali bersama Anto Hoed. "Untuk yang suka dengan lagu ini, jangan terlalu berharap banyak ada klip-nya. Karena kami juga enggak punya modal buat bikin klip," kata Melly dalam unggahan itu.



Tentu saja kalimat 'tak punya modal' di atas sukar dipercaya. Tetapi sejak awal, Potret selalu menawarkan idealisme 'menggemaskan'. Tidak adil untuk mengharapkan Nana Nana memiliki kenakalan seperti 20 tahun lalu, mereka kini sudah dewasa, kehidupan telah berubah, demikian pula era musik 90-an. Bila album ini menandai era baru Potret, maka semangat muda mereka sungguh layak diapresiasi. Semoga, semoga saja, Potret tidak menunggu 11 tahun ke depan sebelum merilis album lainnya. (rea)
text:
Album Review: Portrait - 'Nana Nana'
Nov 04 2019, 08:27 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


After 11 years, Portrait released a mini album titled 'Nana Nana'. (CNN Indonesia / Safir Makki)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - In the 90s, Portrait appeared and gave freshness through the self-titled album in 1995. At that time Indonesia had a lot of bands, but Melly Goeslaw who sang the 'naughty' lyrics still surprised the public. It did not take long until Portrait received a unique and 'fun' stigma. The lyrics were different from most of the songs that were circulating at the time, the arrangements were smart, and Melly's style as a vocalist made him easily recognizable. Portraits II and Cafe followed in 1997 and 1998. Then, From Dawn to Beyond (2001), Positive + POSITIVE (2003), and I Just Wanna Say I LU (2008). Melly and Anto Hoed the husband then developed a career as the most popular Indonesian film theme song pair, and inevitably Portraits did not get the attention they once had. Suddenly, on October 25 Melly announced Portrait had the latest mini album titled Nana Nana. The artwork is lively and lively, featuring Melly Goeslaw, Anto Hoed, Aksan Sjuman, Nikita Dompas, and pianist Mery Kasiman as fillers in Portrait. There are only five songs in this mini album, opened by cheerful Nana Nana, carrying the spirit of 90s Portraits . The lyrics are very simple, and Melly sings in an old style. The outro part clearly shows the song indeed belongs to Portrait. The 90's song is placed as the second. Once again, Portrait only becomes itself with the writing of the lyrics 'origin' which is actually good to say. The 90's song seemed to confirm the myth, 'the 1990s music era was the best'. "Let's all gather together, let's all sing, let's all listen to 90's music. The 90s kids can be proud to be happy, 90's music is the most victorious," Melly said, add to that enthusiasm with the chant, "Hey! 90's!"


Portraits in the formation of five people have survived since 2015. (CNN Indonesia / Endro Priherdityo)

In this song also, Mery Kasiman played the ability to play the keys. Song 90's arrangement feels full, crowded, but fun. The work that has a band sentiment, fresh among the many songs that are all electronic as today. Guitar String opens with a beat that is very typical of Melly Goeslaw. Entering the middle of the song, he suddenly lost his breath. It feels more like a Melly solo song, or project theme song for an Indonesian romance movie. This one, just passed away. Next, is the reality. The same song was published in the album Cafe (1999). There isn't much change in arrangements here, that's why Reality has the strongest sense of portrait. The first time I heard this song in Nana Nana, it felt like it was thrown into childhood. Arrangement The reality of this new version is more full, Melly also displays another singing style than before. Hearing the Reality, will undoubtedly make you miss old Portraits such as Fear of Being Late and Persuaded. As the cover of Nana Nana's mini album, there is no wish to be upset. As per the title, Melly complained about love. He takes on a different vocal color, with a piano intro that has vibrations like in Silence. Ballad-style Portrait, terror that haunts until the song is over. On Instagram uploads where he promoted the mini album, Melly said that Portrait worked on Nana Nana in an 'organic' way. In a sense, all the production processes are carried out in the studio in the residence he shared with Anto Hoed. "For those who like this song, don't expect too many clips. Because we also don't have the capital to make clips," Melly said in the upload.



Of course the phrase 'no capital' above is hard to believe. But from the start, Portraits always offered 'adorable' idealism. It's not fair to expect Nana Nana to have the same delinquency as it was 20 years ago, they are now adults, life has changed, so has the music era of the 90s. If this album marks a new era of Portraits, then their young enthusiasm really deserves to be appreciated. Hopefully, hopefully, Portrait does not wait for the next 11 years before releasing another album. (rea)
